  • Constructor Details

    • AbstractDevice

      public AbstractDevice(String name, String description, int digitalInputsNum, int analogInputsNum)
      Constructor for the AbstractDevice class
      Parameters:
      name - Device name as sent via Link
      description - Device description as set by device detector
      digitalInputsNum - Number of digital inputs the device has
      analogInputsNum - Number of digital outputs the device has

    • enableDigitalInputEvents

      public final void enableDigitalInputEvents(int pin, boolean enable)
      Call this method to enable or disable digital input events for the given pin. Digital input event is called each time a logic value of the given pin changes and the events are enabled.

      The event is registered in Minecraft Forge bus as LinkDigitalPinChangedEvent.

      Parameters:
      pin - The pin to set events on
      enable - true to enable events, false to disable them
      See Also:
      • LinkDigitalPinChangedEvent

    • digitalInputs

      public final byte digitalInputs(int pin)
      Call this method to check the value of digital pin
      Parameters:
      pin - Pin to check
      Returns:
      Pin value

    • analogInputs

      public final short analogInputs(int pin)
      Call this method to check the value of analog pin
      Parameters:
      pin - Pin to check
      Returns:
      Pin analog value

    • processInboundMessage

      protected final void processInboundMessage(byte[] message)
      Method that should be called in each device definition after the inbound message is received.

      This method parses inbound pin state and other messages.

      Parameters:
      message - The message that was received from the connected device.

    • isConnected

      public abstract boolean isConnected()
      This method checks if the current device is connected with the Link
      Returns:
      true if the connection is established

    • validateConnection

      public abstract boolean validateConnection()
      This method provides a wrapper for validation of the connection. Connection is validated based on the device communication implementation.
      Returns:
      true if the connection is still active

    • connect

      public abstract void connect()
      Call this method to initiate connection with the Link device that was detected

    • disconnect

      public abstract void disconnect()
      Call this method to abort the connection

    • sendData

      public abstract void sendData(byte[] dataPacket, boolean force)
      This is a wrapper for sending data to the device. Implementation of this method is specific to the device.
      Parameters:
      dataPacket - Byte array representation of the data to be sent
      force - Forces sending of data even if current device has send interval limit set

    • sendData

      public final void sendData(byte[] dataPacket)
      This is a wrapper for sending data to the device. Implementation of this method is specific to the device. This method will send the data only if the sending interval is not exceeded
      Parameters:
      dataPacket - Byte array representation of the data to be sent
